title.narrative: DEMAND FOR CP SERVICES

description.narrative: Strengthened children and their families capacity to demand child protection services, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, an increased number of boys and girls use a continuum of child protection services aimed at preventing and adequately responding to violence, neglect and abuse and family separation, and equitable access to justice is strengthened for all children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened children and their families capacity to demand child protection services

description.narrative: In 2020 UNICEF raised awareness among 100,000 children and adults on how to prevent and report violence against children and strengthen children and their families’ capacity to demand child protection services. This was done in support to BiH to achieve SDG target 16.2 on ending abuse, exploitation, trafficking, and all forms violence against children by 2030, in partnership with NGOs and financial support from the Swedish Government and the Global Fund to End Violence Against Children. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021
